fShapeToSTRUCT

public static oracle.sql.STRUCT fShapeToSTRUCT(java.lang.Object fshp,
                                               com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.drivers.IConnection c,
                                               int srid,
                                               boolean agu_b,
                                               boolean hasSrid)
                                        throws java.sql.SQLException
Utility method to convert a gvSIG FShape into a oracle struct

Parameters:
fshp - the FShape object
c - the connection
srid - the SRS (oarcle code)
agu_b - whether to check holes validity
hasSrid - whether the SRS is non-NULL
Returns:
a oracle struct representing the geometry
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

getHolesForShells

public static java.lang.Object[] getHolesForShells(java.util.ArrayList all_ls)
This method tries to guess who is a shell and who is a hole from a set of linestrings.

Parameters:
all_ls - a set of linestrings to be checked.
Returns:
a 2-item array. the first is an arraylist of linestrings thought to be shells. the second is an array of arraylists containing the holes of each shell found in the first item

appendGeometriesInStruct

public static oracle.sql.STRUCT appendGeometriesInStruct(com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.core.FGeometryCollection co,
                                                         int _forced_type,
                                                         com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.drivers.IConnection _conn,
                                                         java.lang.String _o_srid,
                                                         boolean withSrid,
                                                         boolean agu_bien,
                                                         boolean _isGeoCS)
This method appends the geometries from a geometry collection in one STRUCT.

Parameters:
co - the geometry collection
_forced_type - a type that has to be used as the struct's main type
_conn - the connection
_o_srid - the geometry's SRS (oracle code)
withSrid - whether the SRS is non-NULL
agu_bien - whether to check holes' validity
_isGeoCS - whether the SRS is geodetic
Returns:
the STRUCT with the appended geometries

getIsGCS

public static boolean getIsGCS(java.lang.String oracleSRID2,
                               boolean thas)
Utility method to find out if a coordinate system is geodetic or not.

Parameters:
oracleSRID2 - the coordinate system's oracle code
thas - whether the table has a coordinate system set. if not, the method returns false.
Returns:
whether the coordinate system is geodetic or not.
